name: Tejas Kandi
title: Robotics Engineer
summary: Experienced Robotics Engineer with 2+ years in ADAS Level 2 systems, embedded software development, and autonomous robotics. Proven expertise in ROS2, computer vision, control systems, and 3D design.

experience.title: Research Analyst - Embedded Systems & Robotics
highlights: Lead comprehensive robotics research projects including autonomous rovers, robotic manipulators, UAVs, humanoid robots
Implement advanced control algorithms: PID, inverse kinematics, path planning
Design and prototype using Fusion 360, 3D modeling, additive manufacturing
Research reinforcement learning for robotic policy training using Isaac Sim

experience.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
highlights: Developed ADAS Level 2 autonomous driving systems on Infineon Aurix microcontrollers
Programmed embedded software using C/C++ and RTOS
Optimized AI models for microcontroller deployment

projects.name: Robotic Arm Manipulator
projects.description: 5-DOF robotic arm with servo actuation, inverse kinematics, computer vision for pick-and-place operations

projects.name: Autonomous Navigation Rover
projects.description: ROS2-based navigation with SLAM, LiDAR obstacle detection, path planning algorithms

projects.name: Self-Balancing Robot
projects.description: PID control for two-wheel platform stability, IMU integration, dynamic balancing

projects.name: Hexapod Walking Robot
projects.description: Six-legged locomotion with gait generation, terrain adaptation, custom mechanical linkages

projects.name: AI-Powered ADAS Demonstration
projects.description: Lightweight CNN for real-time object detection on microcontroller with minimal latency

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering
education.coursework: Digital Signal Processing, Microprocessors, Control Systems, Embedded Systems Design

certifications: Career Essentials in Generative AI - Microsoft & LinkedIn
Six Sigma Green Belt - Quality Management
Six Sigma White Belt - Process Improvement

additional.teaching: World Robot Olympiad (WRO) mentor, Programming tutor
